abilities.name: Damage Bind
abilities.text: Each Pokémon that has any damage counters on it (both yours and your opponent's) can't use any Poké-Powers.

attacks.name: Gigavolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Reflect Energy
attacks.text: Move an Energy card attached to Ampharos to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Bulbasaur

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this Pokémon.

data.name: Caterpie

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: When attacked by bird Pokémon, it resists by releasing a terrifically strong odor from its antennae, but it often becomes their prey.

data.name: Dratini

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It is called the "Mirage Pokémon" because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.

data.name: Weedle

attacks.name: Multiply
attacks.text: Search your deck for Weedle and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: Its poison stinger is very powerful. Its bright-colored body is intended to warn off its enemies.

abilities.name: Froth
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Azumarill from your hand to evolve 1 of your Active Pokémon, you may use this power. Each Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Water Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Water Energy attached to Azumarill. This attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Reflect Energy
attacks.text: If you have any Benched Pokémon and if there are any basic Energy cards attached to Ampharos, take 1 of those Energy cards and attach it to 1 of those Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bad News
attacks.text: If the number of cards in your opponent's hand is at least 6, choose a number of cards there, without looking, until your opponent has 5 cards left. Have your opponent discard the cards you chose.

attacks.name: Prize Count
attacks.text: If you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Aggron

attacks.name: Second Strike
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Guard Claw
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Aggron by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: You can tell its age by the length of its iron horns. It claims an entire mountain as its territory.

abilities.name: Reactive Protection
abilities.text: Any damage done to Aerodactyl by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon is reduced by 10 for each React Energy card attached to Aerodactyl (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Power Blow
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Aerodactyl.

attacks.name: Speed Stroke
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects, including damage, done to Aerodactyl by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon-ex.

data.name: Alakazam

abilities.name: Damage Swap
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to another as long as you don't Knock Out that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Alakazam is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5000.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Doom News
attacks.text: Return all Energy cards attached to Absol G to your hand. The Defending Pokémon is Knocked Out at the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Giga Drain
attacks.text: Remove from Venusaur the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Arcanine
data.flavorText: This legendary Chinese Pokémon is considered magnificent. Many people are enchanted by its grand mane.

data.name: Ampharos

abilities.name: Jamming
abilities.text: After your opponent plays a Supporter card from his or her hand, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon. You can't use more than 1 Jamming Poké-Body each turn.

attacks.name: Cluster Bolt
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy attached to Ampharos. If you do, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any Energy cards attached to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: The tip of its tail shines brightly. In the olden days, people sent signals using the tail's light.

data.name: Beedrill δ
rules: This Pokémon is both Grass Metal type.

abilities.name: Final Sting
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may Knock Out Beedrill. If you do, choose 1 of your opponent's Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns. This power can't be used if Beedrill is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Super Slash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Phoenix Flame
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, shuffle Blaine's Moltres and all cards attached to it into your deck (after doing damage).

data.name: Aerodactyl

abilities.name: Prehistoric Power
abilities.text: No more Evolution cards can be played. This power stops working while Aerodactyl is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: A ferocious prehistoric Pokémon that goes for the enemy's throat with its serrated saw-like fangs.

data.name: Celebi & Venusaur-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Pollen Hazard
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned, Confused, and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Evergreen-GX
attacks.text: Heal all damage from this Pokémon. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Grass Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), shuffle all cards from your discard pile into your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Caterpie

abilities.name: Adaptive Evolution
abilities.text: This Pokémon can evolve during your first turn or the turn you play it.

data.flavorText: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antennae on its head to drive away enemies.

data.name: Bastiodon

abilities.name: Protective Wall
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to your Benched Pokémon by your opponent's attacks.

attacks.name: Anger Revenge
attacks.text: If Bastiodon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Any frontal attack is repulsed. It is a docile Pokémon that feeds on grass and berries.

data.name: Altaria

attacks.name: Midnight Eyes
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Stadium Power
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: It flies gracefully through the sky. Its melodic humming makes you feel like you're in a dream.

abilities.name: Extreme Speed
abilities.text: You pay Colorless less to retreat Arcanine for each Energy attached to it.

attacks.name: Fire Blow
attacks.text: You may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to Arcanine when you use this attack. If you do, flip a number of coins equal to the number of Fire Energy cards you discarded. This attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Metapod

abilities.name: Adaptive Evolution
abilities.text: This Pokémon can evolve during your first turn or the turn you play it.

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to this Pokémon if that damage is 60 or less.

data.flavorText: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. It quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.

abilities.name: Dig Well
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 3 cards of your deck, choose as many Water Energy cards as you like, and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Discard the other cards. This power can't be used if Blastoise is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Aqua Press
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to all Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Double Launcher
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Blastoise. Choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Blastoise can't use Double Launcher during your next turn.

data.name: Blastoise

abilities.name: Rain Dance
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach 1 Water Energy card to 1 of your Water Pokémon. (This doesn't use up your 1 Energy card attachment for the turn.) This power can't be used if Blastoise is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Blastoise but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

data.flavorText: A brutal Pokémon with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high-speed tackles.

data.name: Blastoise

abilities.name: Waterlog
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach as many basic Water Energy cards from your hand to any of your Pokémon in any way you like. If you do, your turn ends. This power can't be used if Blastoise is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Blastoise but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

data.flavorText: The jets of water it spouts from the rocket cannons on its shell can punch through thick steel.

data.name: Articuno

attacks.name: Freeze Dry
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

attacks.name: Luring Flame
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Vapor Kick
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Water Pokémon in play, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Lucario

attacks.name: Feint
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Aura Sphere
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It has the ability to sense the auras of all things. It understands human speech.

attacks.name: Dragon Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, if any of your current Active Pokémon does damage to any Defending Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Dragon Song
attacks.text: Each Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Crobat δ
rules: This Pokémon is both Grass Metal type.

attacks.name: Radar Jam
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Trainer cards (except for Supporter cards) from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Target Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. If that Pokémon already has damage counters on it, this attack does 60 damage instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Bench Guard
abilities.text: As long as Brock's Rhydon is Benched, whenever 1 of your Benched Pokémon is damaged, you may do 10 of that damage to Brock's Rhydon instead. (If more than 1 of your Benched Pokémon is damaged at the same time, you may use this power once for each of them.)

attacks.name: Lariat
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Weedle

attacks.name: Tangle Drag
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Often found in forests and grasslands. It has a sharp, toxic barb of around two inches on top of its head.

data.name: Alolan Exeggutor

attacks.name: Tropical Shake
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each type of basic Energy card in your discard pile. You can't add more than 100 damage in this way.

data.flavorText: As it grew taller and taller, it outgrew its reliance on psychic powers, while within it awakened the power of the sleeping dragon.

data.name: Azumarill

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: When it plays in water, it rolls up its elongated ears to prevent their insides from getting wet.

data.name: Kakuna
data.flavorText: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.

data.name: Dark Ampharos
rules: This Pokémon is both Lightning Darkness type.

abilities.name: Darkest Impulse
abilities.text: As long as Dark Ampharos is in play, whenever your opponent plays an Evolution card from his or her hand to evolve 1 of his or her Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon. You can't use more than 1 Darkest Impulse Poké-Body each turn.

attacks.name: Shock Bolt
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy attached to Dark Ampharos.

data.name: Ludicolo

abilities.name: Table Service
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Punch and Run
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: If it hears festive music, all its muscles fill with energy. It can't help breaking out into a dance.

attacks.name: Heavy Blow
attacks.text: Does 70 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Aggron. If Aggron has any React Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 70 damage instead.

attacks.name: Bound Crush
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) During your next turn, Aggron can't use Bound Crush.

data.name: Tangela

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It tangles any moving thing with its vines. Their subtle shaking is ticklish if you get ensnared.

data.name: Venusaur & Snivy-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Shining Vine
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, when you attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to it, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Solar Plant-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), heal all damage from all of your Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

abilities.name: Safeguard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Banette by your opponent's Pokémon-ex.

attacks.name: Night Murmurs
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, that Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Venusaur V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Pollen Bomb
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Solar Typhoon
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Solar Typhoon.

data.name: Surskit

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It appears as if it is skating on water. It draws prey with a sweet scent from the tip of its head.

data.name: Dialga

attacks.name: Time Bellow
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Flash Cannon
attacks.text: You may return all Energy cards attached to Dialga to your hand. If you do, remove the highest Stage Evolution card from the Defending Pokémon and shuffle that card into your opponent's deck.

data.flavorText: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

data.name: Caterpie
data.flavorText: Perhaps because it would like to grow up quickly, it has a voracious appetite, eating a hundred leaves a day.

abilities.name: Blaze
abilities.text: As long as Blaziken's remaining HP is 40 or less, Blaziken does 40 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Damage Burn
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Ampharos

abilities.name: Jamming
abilities.text: After your opponent plays a Supporter card from his or her hand, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon. You can't use more than 1 Jamming Poké-Body each turn.

attacks.name: Cluster Bolt
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy attached to Ampharos. If you do, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any Energy cards attached to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: The tip of its tail shines brightly. In the olden days, people sent signals using the tail's light.

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.text: Blaine's Arcanine does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Firestorm
attacks.text: Discard 3 Fire Energy cards attached to Blaine's Arcanine in order to use this attack.

data.name: Oddish

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its scientific name is "Oddium Wanderus." At night, it is said to walk nearly 1,000 feet on its two roots.

data.name: Snivy
data.flavorText: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.

data.name: Armaldo δ
rules: This Pokémon is both Fighting Metal type.

attacks.name: Delta Edge
attacks.text: If you have any Supporter cards in play, this attack's base damage is 20 instead of 70.

attacks.name: Fossil Charge
attacks.text: You may discard a Claw Fossil, Mysterious Fossil, Root Fossil, or Holon Fossil from your hand. If you do, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and do 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Caterpie

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: When attacked by bird Pokémon, it resists by releasing a terrifically strong odor from its antennae, but it often becomes their prey.

data.name: Caterpie

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When attacked by bird Pokémon, it resists by releasing a terrifically strong odor from its antennae, but it often becomes their prey.

data.name: Clefable

attacks.name: Fairy Power
attacks.text: Return 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it in your hand.

data.flavorText: With its acute hearing, it can pick up sounds from far away. It usually hides in quiet places.

data.name: Mew

attacks.name: Rainbow Wave
attacks.text: Choose a type of Energy other than Colorless attached to Mew. This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon of that type (including Benched Pokémon). Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon's body is covered by fine hairs that can be seen only under a microscope.

data.name: Dratini

attacks.name: Hypnotic Gaze
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It is called the "Mirage Pokémon" because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.

data.name: Masquerain

abilities.name: Tool Reversal
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may put a Pokémon Tool card attached to 1 of your Pokémon into your hand.

data.flavorText: Its antennae have eye patterns on them. Its four wings enable it to hover and fly in any direction.

data.name: Dark Crobat
rules: This Pokémon is both Grass Darkness type.

abilities.name: Black Beam
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Dark Crobat is your Active Pokémon, you may choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now Poisoned. This power can't be used if Dark Crobat is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Dark Drain
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Remove from Dark Crobat a number of damage counters equal to the number of your opponent's Pokémon in play.

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Pump Up
abilities.text: If your opponent has 3 or less Prize cards left, Drifblim FB gets +40 HP.

attacks.name: Shadow Ball
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. Apply Weakness and Resistance.

data.name: Clefable

attacks.name: Fairy Power
attacks.text: Return 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

data.flavorText: With its acute hearing, it can pick up sounds from far away. It usually hides in quiet places.

abilities.name: Gluey Slime
abilities.text: As long as Ariados is in play, each player must pay an additional Colorless to retreat his or her Active Pokémon. Gluey Slime can't make a player pay more than an additional Colorless to retreat a Pokémon, even if there is more than 1 Ariados in play.

attacks.name: Spider Force
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, this attack does 20 damage and the defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Butterfree

attacks.name: Quiver Dance
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward. If you attached Energy in this way, heal 40 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It loves the honey of flowers and can locate flower patches that have even tiny amounts of pollen.

data.name: Cradily δ
rules: This Pokémon is both Darkness Metal type.

attacks.name: Harsh Fluid
attacks.text: Put 5 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon at the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Poison Tentacles
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Beedrill

attacks.name: Allergic Shock
attacks.text: During your next turn, if the Defending Pokémon is damaged by an attack, it is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Twineedle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: May appear in a swarm. Flies at violent speeds, all the while stabbing with the toxic stinger on its rear.

data.name: Manaphy

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Aqua Ring
attacks.text: Switch Manaphy with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Born on a cold seafloor, it will swim great distances to return to its birthplace.

data.name: Ditto

abilities.name: Transform
abilities.text: If Ditto is your Active Pokémon, treat it as if it were the same card as the Defending Pokémon, including type, Hit Points, Weakness, and so on, except Ditto can't evolve, always has this Pokémon Power, and you may treat any Energy attached to Ditto as Energy of any type. Ditto isn't a copy of any other Pokémon while Ditto is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Capable of copying an enemy's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.

data.name: Chansey

attacks.name: Scrunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Chansey during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Chansey does 80 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: A rare and elusive Pokémon that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to catch it.

attacks.name: Devolution Wave
attacks.text: Count the number of React Energy cards attached to Cradily and choose up to that number of your opponent's Evolved Pokémon. Remove the highest Stage Evolution card from each of those Pokémon, then have your opponent shuffle those cards into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Pidgeot

attacks.name: Supersonic Flight
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon searches for food while flying at Mach 2. Its large claws make fearsome weapons.

data.name: Celebi

attacks.name: Future Sight
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of either player's deck and put them back on top of that player's deck in any order.

attacks.name: Leaf Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon wanders across time. Grass and trees flourish in the forests in which it has appeared.

abilities.name: Form Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys. (Any cards attached to Deoxys, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Deoxys on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Power, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Weedle

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Its poison stinger is very powerful. Its bright-colored body is intended to warn off its enemies.

data.name: Tangrowth

attacks.name: Leaf Storm
attacks.text: Heal 40 damage from each of your Grass Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flog
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can't even see its eyes.

data.name: Dragonite δ
rules: This Pokémon is both Lightning Metal type.

abilities.name: Delta Charge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Dragonite is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Dragonite during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Roaring Flames
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy cards attached to Blaine's Charizard. If all Energy cards attached to Blaine's Charizard provide 2 Fire Energy, discard all of them. This attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each Fire Energy discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Flame Jet
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

data.name: Snivy

attacks.name: Leaf Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.

data.name: Gloom
data.flavorText: The honey it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious, it can curl noses more than a mile away.

data.name: Oddish

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.

data.name: Deoxys

attacks.name: Cell Storm
attacks.text: Discard 2 Psychic Energy attached to Deoxys and remove 6 damage counters from Deoxys.

data.flavorText: DNA from a space virus mutated and became a Pokémon. It appears where auroras are seen.

data.name: Magmar

attacks.name: Controlled Burn
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When angered, it spouts brilliant fire from all over its body. It doesn't calm down until its opponent has burned to ash.

data.name: Weedle

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Often found in forests and grasslands. It has a sharp, toxic barb of around two inches on top of its head.

data.name: Morelull

attacks.name: Sleep Spore
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It scatters its shining spores around itself. Even though they're dangerous, nighttime tours of forests where Morelull live are popular.

data.name: Gallade

attacks.name: Sonic Blade
attacks.text: Put damage counters on the Defending Pokémon until it is 50 HP away from being Knocked Out. If you do, your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic Cut
attacks.text: You may choose as many of your face-down Prize cards as you like and put them face up. If you do, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage for each Prize card you chose. (These cards remain face up for the rest of the game.)

data.flavorText: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using extending swords on it elbows.

data.name: Dragonair

attacks.name: Dragon Pulse
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your deck.

data.flavorText: If its body takes on an aura, the weather changes instantly. It is said to live in seas and lakes.

abilities.name: Power Pinchers
abilities.text: As long as Crawdaunt is your Active Pokémon, when any of your Active Pokémon does damage to the Defending Pokémon, the attack does 10 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

abilities.name: Fire Breath
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now Burned. This power can't be used if Blaziken is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Blaziken.

data.name: Metapod

attacks.name: Iron Defense
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Its shell is filled with its soft innards. It doesn't move much because of the risk it might carelessly spill its innards out.

data.name: Metapod
data.flavorText: Its shell is filled with a thick liquid. All of the cells throughout its body are being rebuilt in preparation for evolution.

attacks.name: Fairy Power
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, you may return any number of your Pokémon in play and all cards attached to them to your hand.

data.name: Charizard

abilities.name: Fury Blaze
abilities.text: If your opponent has 3 or less Prize cards left, each of Charizard's attacks does 50 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Blast Burn
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard 2 Energy cards attached to Charizard. If tails, discard 4 Energy cards attached to Charizard. (If you can't, this attack does nothing.)

data.flavorText: It is said that CHARIZARD's fire burns hotter if it has experienced harsh battles.

data.name: Bellsprout
data.flavorText: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.

data.name: Blaziken

attacks.name: Fire Dance
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Fire Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flame Kick
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to Blaziken. This attack does 80 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Flames spout from its wrists, enveloping its knuckles. Its punches scorch its foes.

data.name: Venonat

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At night, its kind is drawn by light.

data.name: Oddish

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It often plants its root feet in the ground during the day and sows seeds as it walks about at night.

data.name: Tangela

attacks.name: Flog
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: Many writhing vines cover it, so its true identity remains unknown. The blue vines grow its whole life long.

data.name: Alakazam

abilities.name: Damage Swap
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to another as long as you don't Knock Out that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Alakazam is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5000.
